column4: I would like to get some comments on a security tool I have been working on. I am wondering if any would like to take a look?
i would as long as it's open source
so basically you're appending several nmap scans to one 'db' file
or is there more to it?
takes nmap scan to input for amap
then uses regex on that output
and takes the output to a csv file
then is able to handle diffs on the csv
i suppose that could come in handy for info gathering / research
let me know if you try it out
i'll do that - i'm a tad drunk so i dunno how succesful i wil be tonite
heh whenever you get a chance
your pork project looks cool too
let me know if you have any suggestions or any ideas about it
